p:
32. We cannot just “take a look” at being but must pull it out of things. We encounter the being of things as a phenomenon by pulling it out of things. We need the right method in order to properly engage with three elements of that task:
• the starting point of the analysis,
• accessing the phenomenon, and
• cutting through anything that covers it up.
Our goal is to directly grasp and explain what we experience. However, this has nothing to do with the naïveté of some unplanned, unmediated, and unreflective “taking a look” at things.
